body.title: Table of Contents
body.p: Yes, I finally have a (realistic) website. No, the world has not ended. I finally decided I needed somewhere to talk about all the things I was working on so I didn't keep getting asked about them everywhere I went ;P.

If you need to get a hold of me, I at least vaguely recommend connecting to irc.saurik.com and joining #iphone or #saurik. I tend to check it most of the time, but if not at least once a day (so stay connected and be patient if I'm not there right then). If you only have a webbrowser, you can use my web IRC client.

li.em: College of Creative Studies, University of California, Santa Barbara
li.p: B.S., Creative Studies, Emphasis in Computer Science: Complete

li.em: College of Engineering, University of California, Santa Barbara
li.p: Ph.D. Student, Computer Science: Work Ongoing

em.a: jMonitor: Java Runtime Event Specification and Monitoring Library

li.p: Electronic Notes in Theoretical Computer Science
Proceedings of the Fourth Workshop on Runtime Verification (RV 2004)

ul.li: Anakrino - first C# decompiler for Microsoft's .NET
Chora/SVN - web client for Subversion, beating ViewSVN to market
Cycorder - first high speed (MJPEG) video recorder for the iPhone
Cydia - iPhone APT frontend used on >2 million jailbroken devices
Cyrket - Android Market client for desktop web browsers
FQL/JDBC - JDBC driver for Facebook's FQL
ircWAB - HTTP based IRC client, without Java or Flash
Java/iPhone - port of Java to the iPhone (with Objective-C connectors)
Menes/C++ - high-level platform abstraction and utility library for C++
Nmap+V - original versioning port scanner with XML scripting
s3fs - in-kernel, high-performance Linux filesystem for S3
Telesphoreo - distribution of Unix software for modern smartphones
Quotes - Facebook application for sharing what your friends have said
CyberUniverse - web design and consulting company (in high school)
Gnostic Labs - Eschaton: Chain of Command (a team action strategy game)
Let's Cram - social homeworking for high school students
